review: I love this thing. I tried the Roku stick, but this was easier interface and it streamed better. I use it for Sling TV, WWE network, Netflix, and Amazon Prime (Obviously) There aren't as many private channels as Roku, but once you get into Roku, you will be disappointed by those channels quickly and the poor quality of the broadcasts. Screaming easy setup via WIFI. I also use Miracast from my phone and tablet, which works perfectly.
author: M. Bennett

review: I have now put the Fire TV Stick, Apple TV, and Roku through their trials (and so did the kids... RIP Roku). What are we still using? You guessed it, the Fire Stick. Here is why...Small foot-print. I already have enough crap around my TV sticking out everywhere. The fact the Fire Stick tucks away behind the TV is just pleasant. Which brings up to reason 2.NFC remote. The Roku and Apple TV require the user to point the remote at the device. That is all good for us who grew up pointing remotes at TVs. However the next generation... those who are still under 3 feet tall may have difficulty with this. Isn't about time we stopped point at stuff and just used it. The Fire Stick uses some form of NFC i haven't really looked into, but its not line of sigh, and i love it. Also the the Roku did not survive the trials as the kids did something bad to the remote i can't figure out what but it no longer works.However the best selling point for the Fire Stick, has been its application support. The fact i have Plex, Netflix and Hulu on there is priceless. Not a big fan of gaming on the stick, but its also possible and kind of amusing when you can get a bunch of adults playing Cross Roads. Overall a win in my book.
